articles.title: Kim Jong Un Tours Commodity Show Presented by Munitions Industry
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Tours Commodity Show Presented by Munitions Industry
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, toured a commodity show presented by the munitions industry.
					 On display at the show, organized at his proposal, were more than 1 800 kinds of daily necessities which are produced at munitions industrial establishments.
					
					 Kim Jong Un went round the show to learn in detail about the number of consumer goods and their quality.
					
					 Noting that the production of commodities in the munitions industrial field has developed into a patriotic movement for the Party and the State for more than six decades since President Kim Il Sung initiated it in August 1954, the Supreme Commander said: We should always remember the devoted efforts made by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to improve the people's living standard, and convey their loving care for the people down through generations.
					
					 To produce in a larger quantity quality consumer goods at the munitions industrial establishments is for implementing the behests of the great leaders, preserving our own things and giving fuller play to the advantages of our socialist system, he said, urging the officials in the munitions industrial field to steadily push forward this work as an important policy issue.
					
					 He stressed that the officials, party members and other working people in the munitions industrial field should turn out as one in the production of commodities with the strong resolution that they are responsible for the important work to provide the people with richer and more civilized life. 
					
					 It is needless to produce any goods unsuited to the people's taste and what is important in turning out commodities is to sensitively understand what kind of goods the people like and concentrate efforts on the production of goods winning their favor, he said.
					
					 It is the Party's intention to fill every shop of the country with quality domestic commodities, he said. And he encouraged the relevant field to plan this work in a big way and push forward it boldly, saying that he would personally solve the problems arising in the production of commodities.
					
					 Accompanying him were Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yang Gon, Ri Il Hwan, Kim Chun Sop, Jo Chun Ryong, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil, Kim Yo Jong and Jong Sung Il.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from South African Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from South African Ambassador
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Dolana Msimang, South African ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.

articles.title: Greetings to Malian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Malian President
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Ibrahim Boubacar Keita, president of the Republic of Mali, on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic.
					 The message expressed belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Mali would grow stronger in various fields of politics, economy and culture and sincerely wished the president greater success in his work for the country's peace, stability and socio-economic development and people's well-being.

articles.title: Senator from British Labor Party Leaves
articles.content:
Senator from British Labor Party Leaves
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Neil Forbes Davidson, senator from the British Labor Party, and his party left here for home Tuesday.

articles.title: Polish Embassy Officials Help Farmers of DPRK
articles.content:
Polish Embassy Officials Help Farmers of DPRK
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Polish embassy here and Polish guests staying in the DPRK did friendship labor at the DPRK-Poland Friendship Jangsuwon Cooperative Farm on Tuesday.
					 They helped farmers in weeding vegetable fields after being briefed on the history of the farm.
					
					 During a break they talked with farmers.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Laid before Statues of Kim Jong Suk
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were laid before the statues of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk in Hoeryong City in North Hamgyong Province, Kim Jong Suk County, Kim Jong Suk Naval University and Kim Jong Suk General Military Academy on Tuesday, the 66th anniversary of her demise.
					 Present at the floral basket-laying ceremonies were officials of the local party and power bodies and working people's organizations, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, working people from all walks of life and school youth and children.
					
					 Laid before the statues were floral baskets in the names of the local party and power bodies, working people's organizations, units of KPA and KPISF, industrial establishments, farms, schools, etc. and flowers.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Suk before her statues, recollecting her revolutionary career.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Sept. 22, the 66th anniversary of her demise.
					 Seen standing before the bust was a wreath sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Choe Ryong Hae, Ro Tu Chol, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Laid before the bust were wreaths in the names of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also placed there were wreaths in the names of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, units of KPA and the party and power bodies and factories in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to Kim Jong Suk before her bust, recollecting her revolutionary career.
					
					 The chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front visited the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and paid homage to Kim Jong Suk before her bust that day.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Support Answer Given by Spokesman for CPRK
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Support Answer Given by Spokesman for CPRK
Tokyo, September 21 (KNS-KCNA) -- Officials of organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) issued statements on Sept. 19 in support of the answer given by a spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification (CPRK) on shattering the moves of the U.S. to obstruct the improvement of the inter-Korean relations by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					 Ri Jong Man, managing director of the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, said the U.S., which has inflicted all misfortune on the Korean nation for seven decades since the division of the Korean nation, is laying an obstacle in the way of improving the relations between the north and the south.
					
					 Kim Yong Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, noted that the Korean youth and students in Japan will take the lead in the drive for smashing the U.S. moves to hamstring the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and paving a wide avenue to independent reunification this significant year by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, said that the U.S. has put pressure on the south Korean authorities in a bid to put a brake in the wheel of inter-Korean dialogue and improvement of the relations whenever an atmosphere of improving relations between the north and the south was created.

articles.title: DPRK Attaches Importance to Football: Chairman of East Asian Football Federation
articles.content:
DPRK Attaches Importance to Football: Chairman of East Asian Football Federation
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Zhang Jian, chairman of the East Asian Football Federation who visited the DPRK said, when interviewed by KCNA that the DPRK has attached great importance to football.
					 The DPRK gives full play to the great potentiality, he said.
					
					 Women footballers are making shining achievements in international games as expected by their leader and people, he noted.
					
					 The news of the DPRK's women footballers' games has evoked lively response abroad, he added.
					
					 The DPRK, though small in population, proved successful at international games not just because of the players' strong mental power but thanks to the increasing state concern for sports, football, in particular, he noted, adding:
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un greeted at the airport the DPRK women footballers who won the title of the 2015 EAFF East Asia Cup and had a photo session with them.
					
					 I have known well how great he has concern for football.
					
					 He watched games of various football teams of the DPRK and met with players, something rare in other parts of the world.
					
					 During my visit to the DPRK, I intended to propose various issues concerning the development of football in the DPRK, but I felt no need to do so.
					
					 The DPRK is successfully promoting projects at a very high level.
					
					 There are many things to learn in the DPRK, I think.
					
					 I hope that the DPRK would achieve greater success by reenergizing the sports exchange with various countries and steadily developing the educational system on the basis of advanced technology.

articles.title: Birthday Spread Sent to Centenarian
articles.content:
Birthday Spread Sent to Centenarian
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A birthday spread sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un was conveyed to Ri Sun Nyo, a centenarian residing in Sanop-dong, Kangso District, on Tuesday.
					 Born into a poor family in Chongdan County on September 22, Juche 4 (1915), Ri lived as a hired hand at the house of a landlord, undergoing sorrow as a stateless nation.
					
					 She could lead a worthy life in the country liberated by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 She keenly felt his love for the people and gratitude of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government, experiencing herself the agrarian reform after the country's liberation and the socialist cooperativization after the war.
					
					 She worked hard for farming to repay the benevolence of the party and the leader.
					
					 She keeps herself optimistic, having balanced diet.

articles.title: Winner of 12th Grand Bull Prize National Ssirum Contest
articles.content:
Winner of 12th Grand Bull Prize National Ssirum Contest
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The 12th Grand Bull Prize National Ssirum (Korean wrestling) Contest came to an end in Pyongyang some days ago.
					 At the catch-weight event of the contest, Jo Myong Jin, a 35-year old worker of the Sinuiju Shoes Factory in North Phyongan Province, defeated all his rivals to win a bull overweighing one ton, the golden cowbell and a diploma.
					
					 Jo, whose weight is 92.5kg, began training Ssirum over 10 years ago and proved successful at different provincial contests. He is good in physical fitness and has excellent fortes like waist tackle.
					
					 He placed second at the catch-weight event of the Grand Bull Prize National Ssirum Contest in 2009 and third in 2008, 2010 and 2012.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Bandow, senior fellow of the Cato Research Institute of the U.S., one of the major policy institutes in the U.S., released an article accusing the present administration's DPRK policy.
					 In the article he said north Korea, a nuclear weapons state, would not be as foolish to scrap nuclear weapons as Libya, adding Obama's dream to apply the mode of nuclear negotiations with Iran to north Korea turned out to be a pipedream.
					
					 A researcher of the Center for New American Security who worked at the room of the U.S. Defense secretary earlier this year submitted a written testimony which said that the aim to deter north Korea's possession of nukes failed to a hearing of the International Relations Committee of the U.S. House of Representatives, stunning politicians.
					
					 As the reality shows, the U.S. administration's policy to stifle the DPRK has become the target of derision, scorn and contempt.
					
					 In fact, it is rare to find in the history of imperialist aggression such a policy for stifling other countries whose contents have been updated to be harsher with the passage of time as the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. poured huge political, economic and military resources into the operations for seizing the Korean Peninsula, a strategic stronghold for dominating the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 Such policy might work to a certain extent on other countries but in case of the DPRK, a country with a small territory and population, it has always met a bitter fiasco.
					
					 The U.S. sustained a heavy defeat in the Korean war and was compelled to submit a series of papers of surrender to the DPRK in the subsequent period and Washington pushed it to having access to nuclear deterrence. Consequently, it is oppressed by a nightmare.
					
					 The war deterrent of the DPRK has grown so strong as to be capable of reacting to any mode of war desired by the U.S. This made the policy of aggression pursued by the chieftain of imperialism unworkable in the long-run. 
					
					 It is precisely for this reason that the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK is called an anachronistic and bankrupt policy.
					
					 Irony is that the U.S. high-ranking politicians, still pinning hope on it, are fooling around to force the DPRK to disarm itself while talking about the mode of nuclear negotiations with Iran. 
					
					 They are so miserable as to go reckless, failing to face up to the reality in which the structure of the DPRK-U.S. confrontation has undergone a dramatic change.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrence can never be a bargaining chip on a negotiating table as it is an indispensable means for defending the country's sovereignty and the right to existence from the U.S. decade-old nuclear threat and hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 It is thanks to the Songun politics of the great Workers' Party of Korea that the DPRK could increase the capabilities for self-defence with a main emphasis on a nuclear force while foiling the enemies' aggression moves in the biggest hotspot of the world.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will keep holding aloft the banner of Songun that has recorded only victories and glory and the U.S. can never realize its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 Those keen on the anachronistic waste are consigned to the garbage ground of history only.

articles.title: Minju Joson on Human Rights Abuses Committed by U.S. against Koreans
articles.content:
Minju Joson on Human Rights Abuses Committed by U.S. against Koreans
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, an article titled "U.S. oblivious of what it did in north Korea" was posted on the U.S. internet magazine Box.
					 The article said the U.S. should admit that it did something terrible and devilish in north Korea, the U.S. seems to have forgotten this but north Korea always remembers everything and the U.S. dropped over north Korea more bombs during the Korean war in the 1950s than what it did in the Pacific during World War II, leveling all cities of the country and killing tens of thousands of innocent civilians.
					
					 It also recalled that the U.S. Strategic Air Force commander during the Korean war said in 1984 that during the three year-long war the U.S. killed 20 percent of the population of Korea, and U.S. journalist Blaine said such air raids were the most monstrous crimes in the history of wars, adding that it was natural for the Koreans to hate the U.S. so much.
					
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says: Americans admitted the genocide and destruction perpetrated by the U.S. in Korea, though belatedly. This goes to prove that truth about history is bound to be clarified any time.
					
					 The U.S. has so far pretended to work hard for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula while painting itself as "a guardian" of peace and democracy but what it did in Korea was not for peace and democracy. It has perpetrated only monstrous genocide, destruction and plunder.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to make honest apology and reparation for all human rights abuses against the Korean people and withdraw from south Korea without delay.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Conspiracy with U.S. in Anti-DPRK Racket
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities' Conspiracy with U.S. in Anti-DPRK Racket
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The ministries of Foreign Affairs and Unification of south Korea are now busy kicking up a row, crying out for "cooperation" with the U.S., "prompt and effective counteraction" and "close cooperation" over "the north's provocation through projected long-range missile launch and nuclear test." The military bellicose forces staged such confrontation farces as the "reenactment of Inchon landing operation" and a ceremony of unveiling the "monument to the victory in Monggumpho operation."
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Such moves prove that the south Korean authorities remain unchanged in their scenario to stifle the fellow countrymen in the north at any cost in collusion with the U.S. but are becoming ever more outrageous in it.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' cooperation with the U.S. over the nuclear issue of the DPRK is sycophancy toward the U.S. which gets them nowhere, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 For the U.S., seeking hegemony in Asia-Pacific and domination over the world, the Korean Peninsula serves as a springboard for its aggression against the continent. Therefore, what the U.S. urgently requires is neither detente on the peninsula nor improved inter-Korean relations, but escalated tension and deteriorated north-south relations.
					
					 It is a product of this scenario that the U.S. is deliberately pushing the situation on the peninsula to the worst phase and driving a wedge between the north and the south in their efforts to repair the relations.
					
					 Lurking behind such reckless behavior of the south Korean authorities prompted by this sinister scenario is their black-hearted intention to disarm the DPRK at any cost and achieve their "unification under liberal democracy" backed by outsiders.
					
					 The south Korean authorities had better behave themselves, clearly understanding that their cooperation with the U.S. and military confrontation racket against the DPRK are dangerous acts to stem the trend for improving the inter-Korean relations brought about with much effort.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Serious U.S. Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Serious U.S. Human Rights Abuses
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary slams the U.S. for pulling up various countries, styling itself a human rights judge while slandering them and urging them to readjust the legal system and the like through "human rights reports" released every year.
					 The commentary cites the recently published foreign press reports and a report of a U.S. research institute as examples of its ill practices.
					
					 The Russian paper Pravda carried an account of a press interview with an expert of the Council for Relations with Russia who is a political professor at Tennessee State University over a shooting spree made by a man in a city of Virginia State against a TV reporter and cameraman. He commented that gun-related crimes are hard to control in the U.S. and the security of Americans cannot be guaranteed as the U.S. administration is getting nervous about accusing other countries, oblivious of minding its own business.
					
					 The Cato Research Institute in Washington in its report expressed concern over the fact that the white police officer's killing of a young black man in Ferguson City, Missouri State and the human rights abuses in the U.S. have reached an intolerable phase. The institute urged the U.S. to not talk about the American-style "freedom" and human rights before the world.
					
					 All these facts go to prove that the U.S. is the world's worst tundra of human rights and a veritable hell.
					
					 It is the U.S. which should be brought to a human rights court.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop impudently pulling up other countries but put its serious human rights abuses under control.

articles.title: Halt to Campaign for Making "Law on Human Rights in North" Demanded by S. Korean Media
articles.content:
Halt to Campaign for Making "Law on Human Rights in North" Demanded by S. Korean Media
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Minjok Ilbo on September 19 in an article demanded the south Korean authorities halt the campaign to make "a law on human rights in the north."
					 The present "government" is pouring cold water on the atmosphere of reconciliation, cooperation, peace and prosperity between the south and the north created with so much effort, the article said.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The present "government" is trying to railroad the "bill on human rights in the north" through the "National Assembly" this time, talking about the "reenactment of Inchon landing operation" even before the ink got dry on the joint press release.
					
					 The opposition parties are joining in the plots of the "Saenuri Party" though they should stop the rampage of the present "government."
					
					 If the "government" does not halt the above-said racket, it will not be able to escape a miserable fate, censured by the whole nation.

articles.title: U.S. and Its Followers Slammed for Hamstringing Efforts to Improve Inter-Korean Relations
Anti-Japanese War Hero and Newspaper Article
articles.content:
Anti-Japanese War Hero and Newspaper Article
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- It has been 66 years since the demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 On this occasion, the Korean people recall her life as a great revolutionary who always remained loyal to President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It was in November Juche 34 (1945), a few months after the liberation of Korea from Japan's colonial rule, that editors of the then Saegil Sinmun had an interview with her.
					
					 They asked Kim Jong Suk to tell them about the merits she had performed as a woman guerilla during the anti-Japanese guerilla war.
					
					 She answered she had nothing to say about her but much to praise the immortal feats performed by President Kim Il Sung in leading the war to victory. And she began to tell about the superb strategy and tactics employed by the President during the war.
					
					 She said what writers had to do was to give a vivid account of the great exploits of the President, adding the merits of guerillas can go down forever only in the history of their leader.
					
					 Later, Saegil Sinmun carried an article, a part of it reading as follows:
					
					 With a great ambition to liberate Korea, General Kim Il Sung swayed the vast Manchurian plain like a fierce tiger to strike terror into the hearts of the Japanese militarists, displaying his valor all over the world. He is a great revolutionary that Korea has ever had.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Guinean Media
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Guinean Media
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The Guinean media praised President Kim Il Sung's feats for the nation-building and the DPRK's might on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of its founding.
					 The Guinean paper Horoya on September 9 carried an article under the title "Country of the people" illustrated with a photo of the Chollima Statue.
					
					 The paper said that the DPRK is a country of the people as its nomenclature says, adding that the Korean people live free from worries about school expenses, doctor's fee, taxes, joblessness, etc.
					
					 The Guinean Domestic and International Broadcasting Services on Sept. 8 praised Kim Il Sung's feats for the nation-building.
					
					 The media said that the history of the development of the DPRK shedding its rays as a socialist power of independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence would be unthinkable without the his feats for the nation-building.
					
					 The media went on:
					
					 He led the DPRK to adhere to the socialist idea and principle and firmly consolidated the socio-political foundation and the military groundwork of the country.
					
					 His feats for the nation-building were inherited by Kim Jong Il, chairman of the National Defence Commission, and they are now being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Romania
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Romania
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A Romanian national preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) was formed on September 14.
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Socialist Party of Romania, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events including a seminar, meeting, photo exhibition and film show from September 20 to October 10.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed by Foreign Papers
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Papers of Russia and Venezuela carried articles on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The September issue of the Russian paper Serp I Molot said in an article illustrated with the photo of the national emblem of the DPRK:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK on September 9, 1948, 3 years after the liberation of the Korean people from the more than 40 year long-colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 The Korean people have accelerated socialist construction by their own efforts despite the anti-DPRK moves of the U.S.-led imperialists.
					
					 Under the guidance of leader Kim Jong Il, the DPRK turned into a satellite manufacturer and launcher and nuclear weapons state.
					
					 It is fully demonstrating its might as a powerful socialist country independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 The Venezuelan paper Vea on September 9 dedicated one whole page to an article titled "DPRK, people's country" illustrated with the photo showing the happy Korean children.
					
					 The paper said that the DPRK which is guided by the Juche idea called people-first idea is a genuine people's country.

articles.title: DPRK Supported by British Newspaper
articles.content:
DPRK Supported by British Newspaper
Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The September issue of  the organ of the Communist Party of Great Britain (MarxistÔºçLeninist), carried an article titled "Solidarity with the struggle against imperialism!" on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The paper said that the DPRK dynamically advanced the cause of independence against imperialism, holding aloft the red flag at a time when socialism was frustrated in different countries and the imperialist allied forces became ever more undisguised in their moves to stifle the DPRK late in the last century. It went on:
					
					 The Korean revolution has made a victorious advance despite great difficulties and trials thanks to the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) founded by President Kim Il Sung, developed by leader Kim Jong Il and is being steered by Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 No formidable enemy can ever bring the DPRK to its knees as long as there are the leadership of the WPK, unity and cohesion of the popular masses and the Korean People's Army equipped with nuclear deterrence.
					
					 The paper called for waging a positive campaign for supporting the DPRK standing at the outpost of confrontation with imperialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recorre exposicion de articulos de primera necesidad de rama de industria belica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recorre exposicion de articulos de primera necesidad de rama de industria belica
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, recorrio la exposicion de articulos de primera necesidad de la rama de industria belica.
					En esa feria organizada por la iniciativa del Comandante Supremo, estaban exhibidos los articulos de mas de mil 800 generos producidos por varias fabricas y empresas de la rama de industria armamentista.
					
					Recorriendo la sede el Mariscal se cercioro en detalles de la variedad y calidad de los articulos.
					
					Durante mas de 60 anos pasados desde agosto de 1954, cuando el Presidente Kim Il Sung tuvo la iniciativa de producir los articulos de primera necesidad en la rama de industria de guerra, esta labor ha venido desarrollandose como movimiento patriotico de la clase obrera de la industria armamentista para el Partido y el Estado, recordo el Mariscal y destaco la necesidad de transmitir de generacion en generacion el amor por el pueblo del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, sin olvidar sus trabajos dedicados a la mejora de la condicion de vida del pueblo.
					
					Apunto que producir mucho mas los articulos de primera necesidad en la rama de industria belica constituye el tema para materializar los legados de los grandes lideres, defender lo nuestro y poner de pleno manifiesto la superioridad del regimen socialista de nuestro pais.
					
					Instruyo a los funcionarios de la rama impulsar consecuentemente esta labor tomandola como importante cuestion politica.
					
					Asevero que los funcionarios, los militantes del partido y los trabajadores del sector de la industria armamentista  deben levantarse como un solo hombre en la produccion de articulos con conciencia de que ellos mismos tambien se encargan de la labor importante destinada a ofrecer al pueblo una vida mas rica y culta.
					
					Son inutiles los articulos no deseados por los habitantes  aunque se produzcan mucho, senalo y prosiguio que lo importante en la produccion de articulos de primera necesidad es conocer con sensibilidad cual prefieren los habitantes y concentrar esfuerzos en la produccion de articulos para satisfacer sus demandas.
					
					El Mariscal subrayo que es el proposito del Partido llenar todas las tiendas con los articulos de primera necesidad de buena calidad producidos por nuestra propia cuenta y agrego que el mismo resolvera los problemas pendientes y brindara ayuda activa a la produccion de esos articulos para que los sectores concernientes organicen y lleven adelante con valentia esta labor.
					
					El Mariscal fue acompanado por Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yang Gon, Ri Il Hwan, Kim Chun Sop, Jo Chun Ryong, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil, Kim Yo Jong y Jong Sung Il.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador sudafricano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de nuevo embajador sudafricano
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Dolana Msimang presento este martes en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, las cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Sudafricana en la RPDC. 
					Tras recibirlas, Kim departio con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Mali
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Mali
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 22 al presidente de la Republica de Mali, Ibrahim Boubacar Keita con motivo del 55o aniversario de la proclamacion de la Republica.
					El remitente expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Mali con larga tradicion historica se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran en todos los dominios de la politica, la economia y la cultura y le desea de todo corazon al destinatario mayores exitos en sus labores para la paz, la estabilidad y el desarrollo socioeconomico del pais y el bienestar del pueblo.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela nuevo crimen de lesa humanidad de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela nuevo crimen de lesa humanidad de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, la revista online estadounidense Box publico un articulo intitulado "EE.UU. olvida lo que hizo en el Norte de Corea". 
					El articulo senala que EE.UU. debe reconocer sus acciones horribles y diabolicas hechas en el Norte de Corea y agrega que aunque EE.UU. no las recuerda, pero el Norte de Corea las tiene en la memoria. 
					
					Y menciona que en el periodo de la pasada guerra coreana de la decada de 1950, EE.UU. lanzo sobre el Norte de Corea bombas mucho mas que las lanzadas en el Oceano Pacifico en la segunda guerra mundial, debido a lo cual quedaron devastadas todas las ciudades coreanas y muertos o lesionados incontables civiles inocentes. 
					
					Transmite que el aquel comandante de las fuerzas aereas estrategicas norteamericanas en el periodo de la guerra coreana confeso en 1984 que "durante tres anos de la guerra matamos el 20 % de toda la poblacion coreana".
					
					Como vemos, los mismos estadounidenses reconocieron las matanzas y otros crimenes cometidos en Corea en el periodo de la guerra coreana. Esto demuestra que es inocultable la verdad de la historia.
					
					Senala asi el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este martes y prosigue:
					
					Hasta la fecha EE.UU. actuo como si se hubiera esforzado por la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana autodenominandose como "defensor" de la paz y la democracia, pero cometio en Corea las matanzas, destrucciones y saqueos. 
					
					EE.UU. debe pedir perdon y hacer indemnizacion por sus crimenes de lesa humanidad cometidos contra el pueblo coreano y retirarse sin demora del suelo surcoreano.

articles.title: Minju Joson rechaza colaboracion nuclear anti-RPDC del Sur de Corea y EE.UU.
articles.content:
Minju Joson rechaza colaboracion nuclear anti-RPDC del Sur de Corea y EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Los ministerios de Relaciones Exteriores y de Unificacion del Sur de Corea arman alborotos insistiendo en la "colaboracion" con Estados Unidos, "represalia rapida y efectiva" y "estrecha cooperacion" frente al "lanzamiento de misil de largo alcance y la prueba nuclear del Norte de Corea". En tanto, los belicistas del circulo militar desarrollan la "representacion de la operacion de desembarco en Inchon" y la ceremonia de develamiento del "monumento a la victoria en la operacion de Monggumpho". 
					Tales hechos evidencian que es invariable y se torna mas siniestra la ambicion de las autoridades surcoreanas de aplastar en contubernio con EE.UU. a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Senala el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de este martes y continua:
					
					EE.UU., que persigue tomar la hegemonia en la region de Asia-Pacifico y el resto del mundo, considera la Peninsula Coreana como trampolin de agresion al continente. En este contexto, lo mas imprescindible para el imperio no es la distension de la Peninsula Corea ni la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas, sino la agravacion de la situacion y el empeoramiento de los vinculos Norte-Sur. 
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas se adhieren a tal artimana de EE.UU. con el designio de desarmar a la parte connacional y lograr la "unificacion bajo el sistema democratico y liberal" bajo el amparo del imperio. 
					
					Ellas deben actuar con prudencia teniendo presente que la colaboracion con EE.UU. y la campana conflictiva militar daran marcha atras al ambiente de la mejora de las relaciones intercoreanas preparado a duras penas.
